wikipedia_page.main: Edith Coleridge (1832 – January 24, 1911) was a British author. She edited The Memoir and Letters of Sara Coleridge (1873), a popular biography of her mother. An archive of her collected works is held at the Henry Ransom Center at the University of Texas at Austin.

response: Her daughter, Edith Coleridge, edited a biography of Sara, The Memoir and Letters of Sara Coleridge (1873), which helped to preserve her mother's legacy.
*Memoir and Letters of Sara Coleridge, edited by Edith Coleridge at Internet Archive
